The Dream is the eighth studio album released by ambient techno group The Orb in September 2007(U.S. release 17 June 2008). The album features somewhat of a return to the earlier sound of the Orb (notably, ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œThe Truth IsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¦ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ features the same vocal sample as the groupÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s early-90s single, ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œBlue RoomÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½), and shares much more in common with their 2004 album Bicycles and Tricycles than with their minimal 2005 release, Okie Dokie ItÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s the Orb on Kompakt.

The Dream was released in Japan in 2007 and the following year in the US and UK. Orb member Thomas Fehlmann was absent on the album and Paterson was instead reunited with Martin Glover and joined by Tim Bran of Dreadzone. The album features more of a return to The OrbÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s sounds of the early 1990s, with peculiar vocals and playful samples. The Orb also brought in jazz and house music singer Juliet Roberts, guitarist Steve Hillage, and Aki Omori, who had worked with The Orb on Cydonia.
